author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8

segments.pli: 7. Bhūmicālavagga
segments.en: 7. Earthquakes

segments.pli: 61. Icchāsutta
segments.en: 61. Desire

segments.pli: “Aṭṭhime, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are eight kinds of people found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame aṭṭha?
segments.en: What eight?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: First, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato lābhāya lābho nuppajjati.
segments.en: But material possessions don’t come to them.

segments.pli: So tena alābhena socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: And so they sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion because they don’t get those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya, na ca lābhī, socī ca paridevī ca, cuto ca saddhammā’. (1)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. But when possessions don’t come to them, they sorrow and lament. They’ve fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato lābhāya lābho uppajjati.
segments.en: And material possessions do come to them.

segments.pli: So tena lābhena majjati pamajjati pamādamāpajjati.
segments.en: And so they become indulgent and fall into negligence regarding those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya, lābhī ca madī ca pamādī ca, cuto ca saddhammā’. (2)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. And when possessions come to them, they become intoxicated and negligent. They’ve fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So na uṭṭhahati na ghaṭati na vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa anuṭṭhahato aghaṭato avāyamato lābhāya lābho nuppajjati.
segments.en: And material possessions don’t come to them.

segments.pli: So tena alābhena socati, kilamati, paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: And so they sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion because they don’t get those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, na uṭṭhahati na ghaṭati na vāyamati lābhāya, na ca lābhī, socī ca paridevī ca, cuto ca saddhammā’. (3)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. And when possessions don’t come to them, they sorrow and lament. They’ve fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So na uṭṭhahati, na ghaṭati, na vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa anuṭṭhahato, aghaṭato, avāyamato lābhāya lābho uppajjati.
segments.en: But material possessions do come to them.

segments.pli: So tena lābhena majjati, pamajjati, pamādamāpajjati.
segments.en: And so they become indulgent and fall into negligence regarding those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, na uṭṭhahati na ghaṭati na vāyamati lābhāya, lābhī ca madī ca, pamādī ca, cuto ca saddhammā’. (4)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. But when possessions come to them, they become intoxicated and negligent. They’ve fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato lābhāya lābho nuppajjati.
segments.en: But material possessions don’t come to them.

segments.pli: So tena alābhena na socati na kilamati na paridevati, na urattāḷiṃ kandati, na sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: But they don’t sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion because they don’t get those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya, na ca lābhī, na ca socī na ca paridevī, accuto ca saddhammā’. (5)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. But when possessions don’t come to them, they don’t sorrow and lament. They haven’t fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato lābhāya lābho uppajjati.
segments.en: And material possessions do come to them.

segments.pli: So tena lābhena na majjati, na pamajjati, na pamādamāpajjati.
segments.en: But they don’t become indulgent and fall into negligence regarding those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, uṭṭhahati ghaṭati vāyamati lābhāya, lābhī ca, na ca madī na ca pamādī, accuto ca saddhammā’. (6)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. But when possessions come to them, they don’t become intoxicated and negligent. They haven’t fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So na uṭṭhahati, na ghaṭati, na vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa anuṭṭhahato, aghaṭato, avāyamato lābhāya lābho nuppajjati.
segments.en: And material possessions don’t come to them.

segments.pli: So tena alābhena na socati, na kilamati, na paridevati, na urattāḷiṃ kandati, na sammohaṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: But they don’t sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion because they don’t get those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, na uṭṭhahati, na ghaṭati, na vāyamati lābhāya, na ca lābhī, na ca socī na ca paridevī, accuto ca saddhammā’. (7)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. And when possessions don’t come to them, they don’t sorrow and lament. They haven’t fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato nirāyattavuttino icchā uppajjati lābhāya.
segments.en: Next, when a mendicant stays secluded, living independently, a desire arises for material possessions.

segments.pli: So na uṭṭhahati, na ghaṭati, na vāyamati lābhāya.
segments.en: They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them.

segments.pli: Tassa anuṭṭhahato aghaṭato avāyamato lābhāya lābho uppajjati.
segments.en: But material possessions do come to them.

segments.pli: So tena lābhena na majjati, na pamajjati, na pamādamāpajjati.
segments.en: But they don’t become indulgent and fall into negligence regarding those material possessions.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave:
segments.en: This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu iccho viharati lābhāya, na uṭṭhahati, na ghaṭati, na vāyamati lābhāya, lābhī ca, na ca madī na ca pamādī, accuto ca saddhammā’. (8)
segments.en: a mendicant who lives desiring material possessions. They don’t try hard, strive, and make an effort to get them. And when possessions come to them, they don’t become intoxicated and negligent. They haven’t fallen from the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the eight people found in the world.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are eight kinds of people found in…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha describes eight cases where a mendicant has a desire for material things. Sometimes they fall under the sway of that desire, but sometimes they rise above it.
